Package ss.pentago.network.client

Class OnlineClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • ss.pentago.network.client.Client
      • ss.pentago.network.client.OnlineClient
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AutomatedClient
    public class OnlineClient
extends Client
    The OnlineClient maintains a list of listeners to update whenever something noteworthy happens. It also has an InputHandler to obtain user input and tells the OnlineClient what to do. Furthermore, the OnlineClient communicates with the server by means of a ProtocolHandler, this communication may also be forwarded to its listeners.

    • Constructor Detail

      • OnlineClient

        public OnlineClient​(Player player)
        Create a new Client. The player parameter is used for the username, and to be able to request hints (in case of a HumanPlayer), or be able to call AI moves (in case of an AIPlayer).

        After creating a new instance of OnlineClient, the intended use is to call Client.addListener(ClientListener), Client.setInputHandler(InputHandler) and setProtocolHandler(ClientProtocolHandler).
        Parameters:
        player - the player

    • Method Detail

      • connect

        public boolean connect​(java.net.InetAddress address,
                       int port)
        Establishes a connection to a server with specified address and port.
        Parameters:
        address - server address
        port - server port, between 0 and 65535 (inclusive)
        Returns:
        true when the connection is established

      • send

        public boolean send​(java.lang.String message)
        Sends specified message to the socket output stream. This method should be called by a ClientProtocolHandler after formatting the message accordingly. When a writing error occurs, the socket is closed.
        Parameters:
        message - the message
        Returns:
        false when a writing error occurred, true otherwise

      • run

        public void run()
        Continually receive server messages.

      • disconnect

        public void disconnect()
        Disconnect this OnlineClient by calling close() to close the Socket, stopping the InputHandler and cleaning up the listeners.

      • close

        public void close()
        End the game if it's playing, clear the listeners, and close the socket.
        Overrides:
        close in class Client

      • getMove

        public Move getMove()
        If this Client has a HumanPlayer, this function can be used to return a "hint". If this Client has an AIPlayer, this can be used to return the move the AI would make.
        Specified by:
        getMove in class Client
        Returns:
        null when not in a game, the move otherwise

        Parameters:

      • startGame

        public void startGame​(Player player1,
                      Player player2)
        This method should be invoked after the ClientProtocolHandler receives a new game event from the server. This method will then keep a local copy of the game to perform various queries and commands on the game state.
        What type of Player player1 and player2 are doesn't really matter, since they are just used as containers for player names and marbles, as Game expects Player objects. After all, human/bot input is handled by the InputHandler, not the Player, and the opponent's moves are received from the server.
        Parameters:
        player1 - the first player
        player2 - the second player
